channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-16972] Log more details for Scan#next request when responseTooSlow
item.description:
Currently for if responseTooSlow happens on the scan.next call, we will get warn log like below:

2016-10-31 11:43:23,430 WARN  [RpcServer.FifoWFPBQ.priority.handler=5,queue=1,port=60193] ipc.RpcServer(2574):

(responseTooSlow): {"call":"Scan(org.apache.hadoop.hbase.shaded.protobuf.generated.ClientProtos$ScanRequest)",

"starttimems":1477885403428,"responsesize":52,"method":"Scan","param":"scanner_id: 11 number_of_rows: 2147483647

close_scanner: false next_call_seq: 0 client_handles_partials: true client_handles_heartbeats: true

track_scan_metrics: false renew: false","processingtimems":2,"client":"127.0.0.1:60254","queuetimems":0,"class":"HMaster"}

From which we only have a scanner_id and impossible to know what exactly this scan is about, like against which region of which table.

After this JIRA, we will improve the message to something like below (notice the last line):

2016-10-31 11:43:23,430 WARN  [RpcServer.FifoWFPBQ.priority.handler=5,queue=1,port=60193] ipc.RpcServer(2574):

(responseTooSlow): {"call":"Scan(org.apache.hadoop.hbase.shaded.protobuf.generated.ClientProtos$ScanRequest)",

"starttimems":1477885403428,"responsesize":52,"method":"Scan","param":"scanner_id: 11 number_of_rows: 2147483647

close_scanner: false next_call_seq: 0 client_handles_partials: true client_handles_heartbeats: true

track_scan_metrics: false renew: false","processingtimems":2,"client":"127.0.0.1:60254","queuetimems":0,"class":"HMaster",

"scandetails":"table: hbase:meta region: hbase:meta,,1.1588230740"}
item.summary: Log more details for Scan#next request when responseTooSlow

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Uploading the initial patch

This message was automatically generated.

HadoopQA report looks good, the timed out UT cases are known flaky ones and irrelative to change here.

Waiting for another +1 to commit this one (smile).
lgtm

The new extra info looks good!
Minor: For the scan request without the scanner_id (probably the first request?), the request would have the region you need?

+1 for the sentiment (more info when slow response).

Does RpcServer have to have direct references to import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.RSRpcServices; and to import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.shaded.protobuf.generated.ClientProtos; though?

Thanks.

Yes, for the first scan request (ScannerCallable#openScanner or ClientSmallScanner#rpcCall), it will include the region info natively. If it's too slow, we would see something like:

2016-11-01 10:34:33,697 WARN  [RpcServer.FifoWFPBQ.default.handler=4,queue=0,port=54492] ipc.RpcServer(2574):

(responseTooSlow): {"call":"Scan(org.apache.hadoop.hbase.shaded.protobuf.generated.ClientProtos$ScanRequest)",

"starttimems":1477967673696,"responsesize":8,"method":"Scan","param":"region { type: REGION_NAME value:

\"testReversedScanUnderMultiRegions,005,1477967671055.de8f4c6457fbd1712878d09073b5b6b9.\" } scan { start_row:

\"005\\377\\377\\377\\377" max_versions: 1 cache_blocks: true max_result_size: 2097152 reversed: true

caching: 2147483647 } number_of_rows: 0 close_scanner: false client_handles_partials: true client_handles_heartbeats:

true track_scan_metrics: false","processingtimems":3,"client":"127.0.0.1:54591","queuetimems":0,

"class":"MiniHBaseClusterRegionServer"}

And this is why we only improve the w/ scanner_id case here.

Does RpcServer have to have direct references to import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.RSRpcServices

I'm afraid so, since it's RSRpcServices where the scannerId->RegionScannerHolder mapping is held, we only have scanner_id for the scan.next call, so we need to get scan details through such mapping.

and to import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.shaded.protobuf.generated.ClientProtos; though?

The answer is also a Yes here, per above response to Jerry's question, we don't need to do such parsing for the openScanner call, so we need to check whether the request is ScanRequest, do some casting, check whether it has a scanner id, and do parsing if so.

Please let me know if you have better idea for the above two places sir, thanks.

One suggestion is that you have the ScanRequest protobuf. Elsewhere in RpcServer we print out the param. You might do same here. Here is an example output w/ the param printed out. Doesn't have table name but taht is in the region. See what you think.


2016-10-20 13:05:21,302 TRACE org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ipc.RpcServer: callId: 461613696 service: ClientService methodName: Scan size: 323 connection: 172.17.183.15:54355 param: region { type: REGIO      N_NAME value: "raw_support_case,5008000000ecQyfAAE\000\000\377\377\377\377\253G\312,1426540404421.2ea42fcd1adf3b64336c38bcd67fed6f." } scan { column { family: "observable" qualifier: "dirty" } sta      rt_row: "5008000000ecQyfAAE\000\000\377\377\377\377\253G\312" filter { name: "org.apache.hadoop.hbase.filter.SingleColumnValueFilter" serialized_filter: "\n\nobservable\022\005dirty\030\002\"8\n/o      rg.apache.hadoop.hbase.filter.BinaryComparator\022\005\n\003\n\001\001(\0010\001" } max_versions: 1 cache_blocks: true caching: 100 } number_of_rows: 0 close_scanner: false connection: 172.17.183.      15:54355, response scanner_id: 35453111 more_results: true ttl: 60000 queueTime: 0 processingTime: 1 totalTime: 1

I'm afraid we only have such information for openScanner call and don't for scan.next, and I believe the above trace log is for openScanner. I'm referring to ScannerCallable#rpcCall:


      if (this.scannerId == -1L) {

        this.scannerId = openScanner();

      } else {

        Result [] rrs = null;

        ScanRequest request = null;

        // Reset the heartbeat flag prior to each RPC in case an exception is thrown by the server

        setHeartbeatMessage(false);

        try {

          incRPCcallsMetrics();

          request = RequestConverter.buildScanRequest(scannerId, caching, false, nextCallSeq,

                this.scanMetrics != null, renew);

For openScanner we have


    ScanRequest request = RequestConverter.buildScanRequest(

        getLocation().getRegionInfo().getRegionName(), this.scan, 0, false);

With region info, but other case only


          request = RequestConverter.buildScanRequest(scannerId, caching, false, nextCallSeq,

                this.scanMetrics != null, renew);

Correct me if I'm missing something

I've also checked the lines printing above trace log, it's RpcServer$Call#toString and using


    public String toString() {

      return toShortString() + " param: " +

        (this.param != null? ProtobufUtil.getShortTextFormat(this.param): "") +

        " connection: " + connection.toString();

    }

And we already got the param printed in logResponse with same method:


  void logResponse(Message param, String methodName, String call, String tag,

      String clientAddress, long startTime, int processingTime, int qTime,

      long responseSize)

          throws IOException {

    // base information that is reported regardless of type of call

    Map<String, Object> responseInfo = new HashMap<String, Object>();

    responseInfo.put("starttimems", startTime);

    ...

    responseInfo.put("param", ProtobufUtil.getShortTextFormat(param));

But believe me we won't get any scan details in real world for scan.next (Smile).

Ok. Thanks for checking. +1 on the patch. I don't like the pollution of RpcServer with notions of Region, etc., but the value of being able to see what region and table go with the slow scan report is worth it. On commit add note that this patch is acknoledged as a problem and that if possible, we should do something else. Thanks Yu Li

I don't like the pollution of RpcServer with notions of Region, etc...On commit add note that this patch is acknoledged as a problem and that if possible, we should do something else.

Mind further explain this sir? The table and region information is got from RSRpcServices which already holds them and we're only passing the RSRpcServices instance into RpcServer. So you mean to try to remove the reference of RSRpcServices? Thanks.
RpcServer is marked LimitedPrivate and exposed to Phoenix. Not sure how it is being used from CPs. The change in constructor is ok? Pls check.
Thanks for the note Anoop Sam John, let me check.
Thanks for the note Anoop Sam John, you are right, let me update the patch to avoid the constructor change.
Update patch to address review comments and keep RpcServer compatible.
Yes. RpcServer ipc package should not have regionserver package stuff in it... Should not be polluted w/ the concerns of the internal workings of the RegionServer.
+1 (add comment on commit)
I see, was a little bit confused about what comment to add but clear now. Thanks for the clarification sir.

New patch added a TODO comment about removing the reference of RSRpcServices inside RpcServer when possible.

Will commit the patch if HadoopQA looks good. Thanks all for review Ted Yu stack Jerry He Anoop Sam John

Pushed into master and branch-1.

For branch-1.1/1.2, we don't have the preceding patch HBASE-16033 in them, since it's also Operability improvement, mind if I also backport HBASE-16033 plus this one? stack Sean Busbey Nick Dimiduk

For branch-1.3, I guess it's ok to get this in since it's only a change on logging and improves operability? Mikhail Antonov

FAILURE: Integrated in Jenkins build HBase-Trunk_matrix #1901 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-Trunk_matrix/1901/)
HBASE-16972 Log more details for Scan#next request when responseTooSlow (liyu: rev b1d1dc856952176bd45fea88175a62c65e55004b)

  • (edit) hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/ipc/RpcServer.java
  • (edit) hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/regionserver/RSRpcServices.java
  • (edit) hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/ipc/RpcServerInterface.java

FAILURE: Integrated in Jenkins build HBase-1.4 #512 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-1.4/512/)
HBASE-16972 Log more details for Scan#next request when responseTooSlow (liyu: rev 514add00867631f5f3c83caad6bb5c172ac8c1f0)

  • (edit) hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/ipc/RpcServer.java
  • (edit) hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/regionserver/RSRpcServices.java
  • (edit) hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/ipc/RpcServerInterface.java

I'd rather not change the format of existing log lines on a maintenance release. What's the total change in log message appearance with HBASE-16033 and this in place? How likely are we to break downstream folks who have expectations about the log messages we're spitting out?

+1 on the patch in general. I wouldn't want to get it in branch-1.3 right now purely because I want to limit the commit stream to branch-1.3 as much as possible and this is not a bugfix.

Would really appreciate Yu Li if you file a backport jira for that (so this one could be closed), and I'ld be happy to cherry-pick later for 1.3.1. Would it work?
I'd target for 2.0.0, 1.4.0 and 1.3.1 then (unsure of older released branches, let RMs speak)

What's the total change in log message appearance with HBASE-16033 and this in place

Before HBASE-16033 for responseTooSlow logging we only have

2016-06-08 12:18:04,363 WARN  [B.defaultRpcServer.handler=127,queue=10,port=16020]

ipc.RpcServer: (responseTooSlow): {"processingtimems":13125,"call":"Multi(org.apache.hadoop.hbase.protobuf.generated.ClientProtos$MultiRequest)",

"client":"11.251.158.22:36331","starttimems":1465359471238,"queuetimems":1540116,

"class":"HRegionServer","responsesize":17,"method":"Multi"}

And after we will have

2016-06-15 13:43:33,763 WARN  [B.defaultRpcServer.handler=4,queue=4,port=16020] ipc.RpcServer:

(responseTooSlow): {"processingtimems":10776,"call":"Multi(org.apache.hadoop.hbase.protobuf.generated.ClientProtos$MultiRequest)",

"client":"11.251.157.88:56954","param":"region= msgtable,0535:,1465226523303.930e1623ba37566bd44dfca3bfcdd43e.,

 for 1 actions and 1st row key=0535:20160615134322:533698458535","starttimems":1465969402987,"queuetimems":0,

"class":"HRegionServer","responsesize":8,"method":"Multi"}

So we are not deleting any existing message from log but add more details for easier debugging.

And after the patch here will have additional "scandetails" which includes table/region information, and no message removed still.

Honestly, I don't think the responseTooSlow log useful before HBASE-16033, I mean what can we do w/o knowing which table/region the slow request is against...

Sean Busbey let me know your thoughts sir. Thanks.
I think this a good change Sean Busbey Makes a message that looks like it could be useful but isn't into one that actually is by adding a couple of the missing vitals. IMO.

We (Alibaba search) are considering upgrade to 1.3.0 when it's out so the less private patch we maintain the better (smile). But yes it's ok for me to file a backport jira if you insist sir.

And as you may tell, I'm eagerly expecting 1.3.0 to come out.

Yu Li I totally share and support the aspiration to upgrade to latest and greatest bits as soon as they come out! Really glad to see people waiting eagerly on 1.3 to be out, hoping to see lots of early adopters benefiting from it.

But to pave the path for early adoption, we just need to do the best to ensure that once 1.3 is out it's as production ready as possible, and the actual bits need to be well baked in. And since new great patches come in every week , at some point we have to draw the line in the sand and temporarily stop accepting it - to ship. Once it's there, I'll start reviewing candidate patches for 1.3.1, and this list already includes some good stuff.

Meanwhile, in this window, I see 2 options for potential candidates to 1.3.1 - either keep the jira open until 1.3.0 is out, or close it and file a backport jira. For anything less than trivial the latter may be the way to go. What do you think Yu Li?
Agreed, let me file a backport JIRA, thanks for the clarification sir.

Created HBASE-17011 for later backport for branch-1.3

For branch-1.1/1.2, I guess we got a consensus to make HBASE-16033 and patch here in? Sean Busbey stack

Thanks.
Ok, seems no objections for branch-1.1/1.2, will backport HBASE-16033 and commit this one soon.
Done pushing into all 1.1+ branches except for 1.3 (HBASE-17011 will do the backport for 1.3.1). Thanks all for review.

Change appears only to add new fields to a json-ish blob, so I'm (belatedly) okay with this for release lines. It would break folks who are parsing positionally, but it's structured, so they don't have so much room to complain.

Strong objections Sean Busbey? I guess it's already out in 1.2.4, so that's that.
